subject: Ethics
title: Cultural Relativism in Business
description: A short lesson to help you apply Cultural Relativism in Business.

hook.text: In one country, a gift to a partner is polite. In another, it's a felony. Same action, different ethics.

buildup.text: Cultural relativism says moral standards vary by society. What's ethical depends on where you are.

discovery.text: Multinational companies face this daily: follow home country ethics, or adapt to local norms?

twist.text: Taken too far, relativism excuses anything. Child labor, discrimination, corruptionâ€”all justified as 'their culture.'

climax.text: Most ethicists seek a middle ground: respect cultural differences but maintain universal minimum standards.

punchline.text: Culture explains behavior. It doesn't always excuse it.

quiz.question: What is the risk of applying cultural relativism too broadly in business?
options: It can justify harmful practices like child labor as culturally acceptable
It forces all countries to adopt identical laws
